newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire rebels say close to Mbuji-Mayi, Lubumbashi.
newsitem.headline: Zaire rebels say close to Mbuji-Mayi, Lubumbashi.

text.p: Zaire rebel leader Laurent Kabila said on Friday his forces were less than 10 km (6 miles) from diamond capital Mbuji-Mayi, playing down earlier reports the city had been taken.
"We are going forward, we are advancing and we are not far less than 10 km from Mbuji-Mayi and in the vicinity of Lubumbashi," Kabila told a news conference.
Mining sources in Lubumbashi and traders said earlier on Friday that rebels had marched into Mbuji-Mayi after Zairean troops looted and fled to nearby Kananga.
Rebels also launched a bitter attack against the U.N.'s refugee policy and condemned a U.N. human rights report on abuses in rebel territory.

Kabila said he would not reconsider an offer by new Zairean prime minister Etienne Tshisekedi of six cabinet posts for rebels in his government, adding there would be a ceasefire if Mobutu stepped down.

Rebels of the Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo/Zaire (AFDL) who have seized more than one-fifth of the vast country since lat October pose a grave threat to ailing Mobutu, president since 1965.
